trans-unit.source: Node.js
trans-unit.target: Node.js

trans-unit.source: Scenario overview
trans-unit.target: Scenario overview

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, you will create a device that sends the following telemetry to the remote monitoring [preconfigured solution][lnk-what-are-preconfig-solutions]:
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, you will create a device that sends the following telemetry to the remote monitoring [preconfigured solution][lnk-what-are-preconfig-solutions]:

trans-unit.source: External temperature
trans-unit.target: External temperature

trans-unit.source: Internal temperature
trans-unit.target: Internal temperature

trans-unit.source: Humidity
trans-unit.target: Humidity

trans-unit.source: For simplicity, the code on the device generates sample values, but we encourage you to extend the sample by connecting real sensors to your device and sending real telemetry.
trans-unit.target: For simplicity, the code on the device generates sample values, but we encourage you to extend the sample by connecting real sensors to your device and sending real telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: Before you write any code for your device, you should provision your remote monitoring preconfigured solution and then provision a device in that solution.
trans-unit.target: Before you write any code for your device, you should provision your remote monitoring preconfigured solution and then provision a device in that solution.

trans-unit.source: Provision your remote monitoring preconfigured solution
trans-unit.target: Provision your remote monitoring preconfigured solution

trans-unit.source: The device you create will send data to an instance of the [remote monitoring][lnk-remote-monitoring] preconfigured solution.
trans-unit.target: The device you create will send data to an instance of the [remote monitoring][lnk-remote-monitoring] preconfigured solution.

trans-unit.source: Visit [Get started with Azure IoT Suite][lnk-getstarted] to create an Azure account and provision IoT Suite.
trans-unit.target: Visit [Get started with Azure IoT Suite][lnk-getstarted] to create an Azure account and provision IoT Suite.

trans-unit.source: Select **Remote monitoring** when you create your new solution.
trans-unit.target: Select **Remote monitoring** when you create your new solution.

trans-unit.source: When the remote monitoring solution has been provisioned, click **Launch** to open the solution dashboard.
trans-unit.target: When the remote monitoring solution has been provisioned, click **Launch** to open the solution dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Provision your device in the remote monitoring solution
trans-unit.target: Provision your device in the remote monitoring solution

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have already provisioned a device in your solution, you can skip this step.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have already provisioned a device in your solution, you can skip this step.

trans-unit.source: You will need to know the device credentials when you create the client application.
trans-unit.target: You will need to know the device credentials when you create the client application.

trans-unit.source: For a device to connect to the preconfigured solution, it must be able to identify itself using valid credentials.
trans-unit.target: For a device to connect to the preconfigured solution, it must be able to identify itself using valid credentials.

trans-unit.source: You can get the device credentials from the solution dashboard and then include them in your client application.
trans-unit.target: You can get the device credentials from the solution dashboard and then include them in your client application.

trans-unit.source: To add a new device to your remote monitoring solution, complete the following steps in the solution dashboard:
trans-unit.target: To add a new device to your remote monitoring solution, complete the following steps in the solution dashboard:

trans-unit.source: In the lower left-hand corner of the dashboard, click **Add a device**.
trans-unit.target: In the lower left-hand corner of the dashboard, click **Add a device**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Custom Device** panel, click on **Add new**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Custom Device** panel, click on **Add new**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Let me define my own Device ID**, enter a Device ID such as **mydevice**, click **Check ID** to verify that name isn't in use, and then click **Create** to provision the device.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Let me define my own Device ID**, enter a Device ID such as **mydevice**, click **Check ID** to verify that name isn't in use, and then click **Create** to provision the device.

trans-unit.source: Make a note the device credentials (Device ID, IoT Hub Hostname, and Device Key), your client application will need them to connect your device to the remote monitoring solution.
trans-unit.target: Make a note the device credentials (Device ID, IoT Hub Hostname, and Device Key), your client application will need them to connect your device to the remote monitoring solution.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Done**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Done**.

trans-unit.source: Make sure your device displays correctly in the devices section.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your device displays correctly in the devices section.

trans-unit.source: The status is **Pending** until the device establishes a connection to the remote monitoring solution.
trans-unit.target: The status is **Pending** until the device establishes a connection to the remote monitoring solution.
